definition: Isomorphic patterns in Integrated Information Theory (IIT) across scales capture structural equivalences in intrinsic existence, cause-effect power, integration, exclusion, composition, and Φ (integrated information)—mappings where conscious structures preserve causal invariances invariantly. Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates neural cause-effect repertoires (recursive integration for consciousness) and aesthetic wholeness (joyful adequacy through intrinsic power) in human-AI free-will-compatible monism. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical consciousness; tetralemma probes resolve apparent fragmentations (affirm integration/deny reductionism/both in neuresthetic wholes/neither dissolved in intrinsic equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from IIT axioms/postulates with neuresthetic overlays (neural integration, aesthetic wholeness).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum IIT extensions).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., Φ with consciousness analogs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve consciousness paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
